gph.description: Height of a standard or significant pressure level in meters

wspd.description: Horizontal speed of the wind, or movement of air, at the height of the observation

dpdp.description: The difference between air temperature and dew point temperature.  The dew point temperature is the temperature to which a given air parcel must be cooled at constant pressure and constant water vapour content in order for saturation to occur

radiosonde_code.description: Common Code table as from WMO definitions (code table 3685)

eastward_wind_component.description: The harmonized value eastward wind speed component obtained using RHARM (Radiosouding HARMonization) approach

northward_wind_component.description: The harmonized value northward wind speed component obtained using RHARM (Radiosouding HARMonization) approach

water_vapor_volume_mixing_ratio.description: Volume water mixing ratio vapor calculated using Hyland, R. W. and A. Wexler. For details on the calculation formula please check the ATBD

air_temperature.description: The harmonized value temperature obtained using RHARM (Radiosouding HARMonization) approach

wind_speed.description: Horizontal speed of the wind, or movement of air, at the height of the observation

ascent_speed.description: Ascent speed of the radiosonde calculated from altitude: (maximum height reported - minimum height reported) / (time at maximum height reported - time at minimum height reported)

relative_humidity.description: The harmonized value relative humidity obtained using RHARM (Radiosouding HARMonization) approach

geopotential_height.description: Height of a standard or significant pressure level in meters

frost_point_temperature.description: Temperature, below 0Â° C, at which moisture in the air will condense as a layer of frost on any exposed surface. For details on the calculation formula please check the ATBD

solar_zenith_angle.description: The solar zenith angle is the angle between the zenith and the centre of the Sun's disc

actual_time.description: Release time of the sounding in date time UTC

air_dewpoint_depression.description: The difference between air temperature and dew point temperature.  The dew point temperature is the temperature to which a given air parcel must be cooled at constant pressure and constant water vapour content in order for saturation to occur

wind_from_direction_total_uncertainty.description: Value of the total uncertainty for wind direction obtained using RHARM (Radiosouding HARMonization) approach. See section 2-4 of the Algorithm theoretical basis description of the RHARM dataset

eastward_wind_component_total_uncertaint.description: Value of the total uncertainty for the eastward wind speed component humidity obtained using RHARM (Radiosouding HARMonization) approach. See section 2-4 of the Algorithm theoretical basis description of the RHARM dataset

northward_wind_component_total_uncertain.description: Value of the total uncertainty for the northward wind speed component humidity obtained using RHARM (Radiosouding HARMonization) approach. See section 2-4 of the Algorithm theoretical basis description of the RHARM dataset

air_temperature_total_uncertainty.description: Value of the total uncertainty for the harmonized temperature obtained using RHARM (Radiosouding HARMonization) approach. See section 2-4 of the Algorithm theoretical basis description of the RHARM dataset

wind_speed_total_uncertainty.description: Value of the total uncertainty for wind speed obtained using RHARM (Radiosouding HARMonization) approach. See section 2-4 of the Algorithm theoretical basis description of the RHARM dataset

relative_humidity_total_uncertainty.description: Value of the total uncertainty for the harmonized relative humidity obtained using RHARM (Radiosouding HARMonization) approach. See section 2-4 of the Algorithm theoretical basis description of the RHARM dataset
